main event: Two round objects were sighted moving north at an estimated altitude of 30,000 feet in Colorado Springs.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be 6 to 8 inches in diameter and the color was similar to that of a frosted electric light bulb., One object overtook the other in about 2 seconds, indicating exceptional maneuverability., Observations lasted between 25 to 30 seconds as they passed overhead., Witnesses reported no sound or exhaust trails from the objects., The objects were first seen during exceptionally clear weather with unlimited visibility.
witness description: Maj Joe R. Bullock, M/Sgt Leonard Pink, T/Sgt Walter J. Morbeck
